result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Autumn E Riley in court with attorney Julia May for attorney Travis Schwantes.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.
Application for Jail Time Credit form - 0 days

Defendant Autumn E Riley in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bond Remains. Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 23, 2016 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for February 25, 2016 at 09:00 am.

TOTAL BOND COVERS ALL FILES 15CM338 & 15CM269
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Any prescribed medication is to be taken within the terms/limits of the prescription.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Autumn E Riley in court with attorney Melissa Nepomiachi.  Tracy L. McMiller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Not guilty plea entered. Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
